text: the Honda CRV has been America's
best-selling crossover in seven of the
past ten years so it's new small sibling
is a big deal I'm Tom Volk with driven
for the new york times HRV joins chevy
trax Fiat 500x Jeep renegade and Mazda
cx-3 in the current automotive it
segment the compact crossover it might
look like a two-door it's not a sense of
scale HRV is 10 inches shorter than CRV
but small is not exactly what it used to
be
this is nearly six inches longer than
the original five-door Toyota rav4
launched in the mid 90s at twenty six
thousand seven hundred bucks this is a
top-of-the-line
EXL navi model built on the Honda Fit
architecture HRV can be had with
all-wheel drive the larger 1.8 liter
4-cylinder makes 141 horsepower and 127
pound-feet of torque
this is a continuously variable
transmission with sport mode and
simulated manual shift mode like fit the
seating is more flexible than a
five-year-old gymnast excellent for
ducking out of work for a quick path
most will buy it more for driving than
snoozing though with zero to 60 runs
nearing nine seconds
this isn't automotive caffeine the ride
quality is a good solid blend of
compliance and capability in the corners
it's not a sports car and not meant to
be signal right and a mirror mounted
camera offers up view of the blind spots
both helpful and distracting there is
some of that rubbery dynamic common to
continuously variable transmissions you
can eliminate that by going with the
six-speed manual transmission it's only
available in the lower trim levels and
with front-wheel drive the EPA gives the
all-wheel drive HRV a score of 27 City
32 highway I'm seeing 25 in urban
driving keep this ring green and you'll
probably do better than me for venturing
off-road there's six point seven inches
of ground clearance that's just enough
to slog to hiking trail heads with
little drama go with Jeep renegade

nicely the console storage is quite

have better navigation than this set up
good thing there's a few USB ports for
keeping them powered remember this is
not a very big rig and yet two
average-sized adults such as myself
should not complain too much about space
back here foot room is good use the cup
holder or the power port just not both
at the same time I suggest keeping it to
a couple
here the middle position is not exactly
comfy storage under the seat is a

space for a dog it keeps them out of the
